page.title: 06Lace Making
page.content: Lace making was once a widespread cottage industry in Bedfordshire.Now it is regaining popularity as a hobby and it is a popular evening class activity.This can be seen as part of the general revival of interest in crafts,bygones and local history. To make lace you need a lace pillow and bobbins.Bobbins are usually made of wood or bone.All except the South Bucks bobbins have a ring of beads to give extra weight,add a bit of colour and keep the bobbin steady against the pillow.The bottom bead is usually larger than the rest.Bobbins are usually 3 to 4 inches long. One local group is called the Aragon Lacemakers and their members often display their work at village Craft Fayres.Children at Alban School also do lace making as a hobby.
